Articles.Content:
I know some of you may be thinking what why ....

But I would like to see how many stable and decently realistic drift cars(rovers) ( a truck is fine) can be built and kept stable ....
I've already completed this challenge with a classic hotrod build ... not so great looking but accurate and works.... 

Mine is able to stably drift at 2 and even 3 times speed... doesn't need to be fast or high control ... small engines are ok though I didn't use any.
Modifications in looks shouldn't affect how it handles, wings parts shouldn't be able to move ... makes it so easy ... i used to horizontal on the bottom for looks and glide

I set the difficulty as 

moving wings < without SAS < 2xspeed < 3xspeed < High power...

Easy mode < Hard mode

 

.... not sure how to add picture as yet but will do later if I can
Figured out how to add pictures yet? Most people here use Imgur. Albums don't work at the moment but adding pictures is pretty easy.

Nope, I have not yet figured out how to add pictures ... sadly i'm not on imgur, anything else that works ... sorry i took a whole month to reply ... college stuff and all that in the way.

wait a minute that link , kerbal x thanks i'll use that. Please keep in mind it's not pretty it's the first time i'm doing a hotrod or drift car. it's built for convenience more than looks, to cover up the weight distribution.

also it's rear wheel drive, so you can spin out if you want to try it. All wheel drive felt too easy XD ... I was doing reverse entries and stuff XD

Will upload and see how that works and get back to you

Btw can I ask you for a like commission, would I have to pay ... it's a BMW ... forgot name but it was a classic car... used it a lot on NFSWorld ... looks a lot like https://kerbalx.com/Azimech/77I--Lowell-Gandini-10 but it has a wider chassis and had a kit and little lower. If you don't want to, don't feel bad to say no XD
